image.altText: A man holds a placard.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian independent MP who received more than $72,000 in donations from Climate 200 says he will divest his shares in a fossil fuel company, miner and pokies venue operator, as they do not align with his values.

title.children: Climate 200-backed MP has shares in fossil fuels, mining

image.altText: Man stands in front of a large drum of cable.

props.synopsis: The $5 billion Marinus Link undersea power cable project to connect Tasmania and Victoria passes two major milestones, with financing locked in and suppliers ordered start production on key components.

title.children: Secured financing locks Marinus Link in, with contractors given go ahead

image.altText: A pair of hangs holding a stethoscope

props.synopsis: The class action involves junior doctors who worked at the Royal Hobart Hospital and the Launceston General Hospital during the past six years.

title.children: Class action seeks to compensate junior doctors for 'excessive' overtime

image.altText: Concept art for memorial park.

props.synopsis: The mother of one of six children who died in the Tasmanian jumping castle tragedy says she is devastated by a group's attempt to "block" a beachside memorial. They argue the area is "a place for families to escape the hardships of life".

title.children: 'Forced reminder' of jumping castle tragedy opposed by beach users group

image.altText: Two people drag calves by their limbs along an abattoir floor.

props.synopsis: After distressing video was aired showing the shocking treatment of animals inside a Tasmanian abattoir, CCTV cameras were made mandatory. But since then, it has been revealed no record is being kept on whether the surveillance video is being reviewed.

title.children: All Tasmanian abattoirs have CCTV, but it's not known how much footage is watched

image.altText: Aerial shot of large ship leaving port.

props.synopsis: Options for the new Spirit of Tasmania ship to "ease the housing crisis" in Scotland or accommodate "displaced residents" in California were passed over in favour of it being docked at a cost to Tasmanian taxpayers of around $600,000 a month, documents reveal.

title.children: Plan to use Tasmanian ferry to house 'displaced residents' in US revealed

image.altText: A crowd seen from behind with three people wearing the Australian or Eureka flags as capes.

props.synopsis: A history expert says this Australian National Flag Day there should be pause for concern in the wake of the anti-immigration rallies at the weekend.

title.children: 'Weaponisation' of Australian flag denounced in wake of divisive rallies

image.altText: Three men in suits walk in a row

props.synopsis: Former Victorian premier Daniel Andrews was among those who attended, with Donald Trump asking China's leader to give Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un his "warmest regards" as they "conspire" against the US.

title.children: Daniel Andrews attends lavish military parade in China alongside Putin and Kim

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market was unmoved by higher GDP figures released today, and dived on global worries about bonds, higher interest rates and losses on Wall Street. Meanwhile, chances of a September rate cut have "probably disappeared". Follow live.

title.children: $57b wiped off Aussie share market after worst trade in five months

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Is this the infamous September sell-off?
ASX almost has its worst day since April 9

image.altText: Man with grey hair, black rimmed glasses and dark grey shirt looks at camera

props.synopsis: Michael Alford says his wife and he have been left in a "financial no-man's-land" after years spent trying to resolve suspicious transactions that have appeared in the couple's bank accounts without success.

title.children: Couple 'broken, nearly bankrupt' after years of mysterious bank withdrawals

image.altText: This vision shows the moments leading up to the tasering of an Indigenous man by police in Kalgoorlie

props.synopsis: The WA corruption watchdog is reviewing police conduct over an incident where officers twice shoved a man to the ground before tasering him on a Kalgoorlie street.

title.children: 'Police-induced jeopardy': Aboriginal man tasered after giving cops the finger

image.altText: Trinity de Lance holds her arms above her to signal the end of her beam routine and looks to the side.

props.synopsis: A report by an international ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached the human rights of a 12-year-old girl who broke her back while training in excruciating pain.

title.children: Ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached 12yo's human rights

image.altText: Two young boys with white paint stripes under their eyes stand among a crowd. A third pulls the arm of the boy in the middle

props.synopsis: Young Indonesians are taking to the streets to voice their anger at the government and police. This is how the protest turned into a riot.

title.children: 'I feel hopeless for this country': Why Indonesia's youth are rioting

image.altText: High Court of Australia, building, generic

props.synopsis: The man is one of three people who were slated to be removed to Nauru in February under the government's newly minted agreement with the island nation, which was stepped up at the weekend with a $400 million deal.

title.children: Iraqi asylum seeker slated for removal to Nauru loses High Court challenge

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: As the search for Dezi Freeman continues, former police officers say the public should not be surprised if it goes on for months.

title.children: Former officers say police have the advantage in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: The demonstrations held across Australia last Sunday were framed by organisers as "anti-immigration protests" and a chance to "stand up for Aussie culture".

title.children: Do 'good people' stand alongside white nationalists?

image.altText: white man wears glasses and a white t shirt that says 'trans women are not women'

props.synopsis: In one of the posts, Linehan said that "if a trans-identified male is in a female-only space, he is committing a violent, abusive act".

title.children: Father Ted creator Graham Linehan arrested over transgender posts on X

image.altText: A person in a hazmat suit holds a dead bird on the edge of a lake.

props.synopsis: Experts are on edge, fearing this will be the spring that the "catastrophic" H5 strain of bird flu arrives in Australia.

title.children: 'Time of trepidation' as bird flu risk increases in Australia in spring

image.altText: A red Hyundai i30

props.synopsis: Thousands of Hyundai i30 vehicles are being recalled after a defect was found that may cause the engine to stall.

title.children: Thousands of Hyundai i30s recalled over potentially deadly manufacturing defect

image.altText: Gout Gout runs in a 200m race.

props.synopsis: Australian Athletics names its biggest-ever team for a global meet, with five Paris Olympic medallists and teenage sensation Gout Gout among an 88-strong squad.

title.children: Olympic medallists and Gout Gout join biggest Australian team for world champs

image.altText: Alex de Minaur smiles while holding tennis balls at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur knows he needs a few things to go his way to push "all the way" at the grand slams, and he has finally caught some breaks in New York.

title.children: De Minaur needs a little luck to push further. He's got it at the US Open

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles while standing at a podium.

props.synopsis: In another example of a false conspiracy rapidly spreading on social media — fuelled by algorithms that reward hysteria over accuracy — hashtags such as #trumpdead have been trending.

title.children: Trump says he was unaware of viral social media death rumours

image.altText: Cardi B sits in a witness box with long dark curly hair with a neutral facial expression.

props.synopsis: A Californian jury unanimously clears pop star Cardi B of assault allegations in a $36 million civil lawsuit.

title.children: Cardi B cleared of assault allegations in civil lawsuit

image.altText: A greyscale satellite image of a boat moving in dark waters, surrounded by green and blue 'UNCLASSIFIED' markings

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the attack in the Caribbean targeted the Tren de Aragua organisation, in the first-known operation launched since his administration's surge of warships into the region.

title.children: US strike on Venezuelan drug boat kills 11 'narcoterrorists'

image.altText: Traffic sitting at a set of red traffic lights on Beaudesert Road with Brisbane City skyscrapers in the background.

props.synopsis: A trial which allowed drivers to turn left at red lights at signposted intersections in Brisbane was axed in 2021.

title.children: Queensland government considering reviving trial of left turn at red light rule

image.altText: A wooden sign at the entrance to Rawlinna Station.

props.synopsis: A deal has been done to sell Rawlinna Station to a UK-owned pastoral company, but six months on the WA government is yet to approve the sale.

title.children: Red tape slows the sale of Australia's largest sheep station

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows star Izak Rankine breaks his silence on the homophobic slur he directed towards an opponent, saying the word he used is "harmful" and "hurtful" and has "no place in our game or our society".

title.children: AFL star says he will work to regain 'everyone's trust' after homophobic slur

image.altText: Sam with her small baby, smiling in a play area.

props.synopsis: Behind Australia's tug-of-war between office headquarters or working from home, a growing number of employers have found a middle ground, providing the best of both worlds for both their workers and their business.

title.children: A 10-minute commute over 90? Why workers are shifting to shared offices

image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Police say more than 100 properties have been searched as the hunt continues for the gunman who allegedly killed two police officers in north-east Victoria.

title.children: More than 100 properties searched in hunt for alleged killer Dezi Freeman

image.altText: A crowd seen from behind with three people wearing the Australian or Eureka flags as capes.

props.synopsis: A history expert says this Australian National Flag Day there should be pause for concern in the wake of the anti-immigration rallies at the weekend.

title.children: 'Weaponisation' of Australian flag denounced in wake of divisive rallies

image.altText: Three teenage girls stand together in front of a waterway.

props.synopsis: More than two years since catastrophic floods in WA's far north devastated a wildlife sanctuary, traditional owners have returned to country.

title.children: Bunuba people say 'it's good to be home' as they return after floods

image.altText: National Guard troops in camo fatigues stand shoulder to shoulder holding clear shields

props.synopsis: A judge has ruled the Trump administration "wilfully" ignored federal law when deploying National Guard forces during riots in Los Angeles earlier this year.

title.children: Trump illegally deployed National Guard to LA protests, rules judge

image.altText: Siobhan Stagg sings on stage with her eyes closed and her hair in a formal up-do. She wears a blue evening gown.

props.synopsis: From conducting elite orchestras to starring in brand new operas, Australian talent like Simone Young and Siobhan Stagg are shining bright on international stages.

title.children: The world-famous musicians who still call Australia home

image.altText: an angle of the kiluaea volcano in hawaii erupting

props.synopsis: The US Geological Survey (USGS) says the eruption has featured "vigorous lava fountaining".

title.children: Volcanic eruption shoots lava 100m into the air in Hawaii
